function.description:
Connect to an Oracle database. Returns a connection object.
| Parameter | Description | | ---------- | ----------- | | `database` | The database parameter wants the name of the database you want to connect to. | | `host` | The host parameter wants the name of the host. | | `port` | The default port is 3306 but can be set to a different port is necessary. | | `user` | The user parameter is for the username. This is optional. | `pass` | The pass parameter is for the password. This is optional. | `options` | The options parameter is optional. It is used for setting Oracle specific options. |
More information on the options parameter can be found on [http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E13222_01/wls/docs92/jdbc_drivers/oracle.html#wp1066413](http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E13222_01/wls/docs92/jdbc_drivers/oracle.html#wp1066413)

example.header: Connect to the Oracle database "testdb" with user "user" and password "pass".
